Articles.Content:
Anatidaephobia: The fear that anywhere you are, no matter the circumstances, a duck is watching you.

This has so much potential for a Doctor Who episode, don't you think?
Um...uh....don't know what to,say to,this. (Besides,,don't watch Doctor Who)

Um...uh....don't know what to,say to,this. (Besides,,don't watch Doctor Who)

I'll just say that the show has some absolutely wacky aliens in it, including:

Weeping Angels - Angel statues that only attack when you look away from them.

Daleks - Aliens wearing saltshaker-like battle suits who kill whatever isn't a Dalek.

Cybermen - Cyborgs who turn beings into more Cybermen.

Those are the three most recurring aliens in the series. There are far more bizarre creatures as well. I'm sure evil ducks would fit in somewhere.
So, essentially, cybermen are,borg from star trek.

So, essentially, cybermen are,borg from star trek.

Lately, they've become almost exactly like the Borg. They recently have been able to "adjust" somehow to weapons after a few of them take hits, rendering them useless.

(At one point, anyways, maybe that was episode-specific)

Ducks are creepy. Creepier than you think.

See this duck? Pretty ordinary duck, right?

But what if we tease out small features and ENHANCE them? What is the duck HIDING? Let's zoom in and enhance.

This is the true form of the duck. Remember, the duck is watching.

this ad sponsored by the platypus party of The Pond

Notice how their beaks look like dog heads. Could it be a mask? Could they be hiding some terrible fangs under there??

I'm having a little too much fun with this.
